title: Escape spaces correctly in Bash completions
doc: add macOS and linux default import path for autojump
fix: interactive completion for fish
body:
Just as mentioned in #341, use `\#` to indicate full path for zoxide to query.

In my tests it worked well.

resolved #341

title: Limit nix features
body: This removes memoffset as an indirect dependency, and should slightly decrease build times.

title: Add felix to 3rd party integrations
body:
This PR updates the 3rd party integrations table in README.
In felix, which is a tui file manager I maintain, `:z <keyword>` lets user jump to a directory tha t matches the keyword. Internally felix calls `zoxide query <keyword>`.

Best regards.

title: switch elvish template to new try/catch syntax
body:
'except' has been deprecated and replaced by 'catch' in elvish 0.18, and will be removed in 0.19

see the relevant issue here: https://github.com/elves/elvish/issues/1497

title: Simplify fish init script
body:
- Remove usage of `__zoxide_unset`.
  - There is no need to remove namesake variables, which don't even make sense.
  - Similarly, no need to remove abbrs. Users should know better than to set an abbreviation with the same name.
  - New functions will discard old ones with the same name.

- Replace `alias` with idiomatic `function`.

  fish's [`alias`](https://fishshell.com/docs/current/cmds/alias.html) is simply a function wrapper and slower than defining functions directly.

title: Copy owner from previous database file
Update Nushell script to support engine-q
body:
Closes #345.

CC @fennewald I would love a review on this.

title: Fix Windows _ZO_DATA_DIR path in Readme
body: `_ZO_DATA_DIR` in Windows is actually located at `%LOCALAPPDATA%`, not in `%APPDATA%`

title: Improve fzf readability on narrow screens
body:
[--keep-right] trims paths from the left/start, preventing long folder
chains from taking over the prompt and making the choice ambiguous:

Without it:
```
/long/folder/chain/with/same/prefi...
/long/folder/chain/with/same/prefi...
/long/folder/chain/with/same/prefi...
/long/folder/chain/with/same/prefi...
```

With it:
```
...der/chain/with/same/prefix/folder1
...der/chain/with/same/prefix/folder2
...der/chain/with/same/prefix/folder3
...der/chain/with/same/prefix/folder4
```

Thanks for taking the time to write this awesome utility!

[--keep-right]: https://www.mankier.com/1/fzf#--keep-right

title: --interactive/-i and --score/-s do not conflict in Query::query()
Use elvish v0.17 lambda syntax in completions generation
Add path escapes for powershell
body:
Fixes #312

Adds path escape to `Set-Location` call, fixing compatibility with paths containing special characters like square brackets.

title: fix: don't error during __zoxide_unset
body: If `set -e` is enabled then `eval $(zoxide init zsh)` errors when the alias aren't already set (eg: in a fresh shell). This fixes that.

title: PowerShell: use global scope for aliases
Addition of Minimum Supported Version of Rust
Upgrade to clap beta5
body:
Fixes https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide/issues/286.

Also changes installation instructions to use `--locked` which would prevent this.

title: use env macro over runtime in build script
body:
env!() fails on compile time while env::var fails on executing the build script.

Also rerun the build when the build.rs changed.

title: Improve release action
body:
- include completions in release binary
- create binary for raspberry pi zero / 1
- create binary for M1 / arm64 macOS
- always build and only release on tags. All commits and PRs are also tested this way to ensure builds are working for the various platforms.
- Artifacts are always created which is helpful for testing branches and not yet released versions.

Minor Improvements:
- Dont define targets twice in matrix. This is less error prone
- generate version via `git describe`. This also includes versions in between releases (in artifacts).
- use-cross is done via function and not hardcoded
- GitHub Releases are done at the end of each job which simplifies the logic.
- dont use --color=always as actions-rs/cargo provides better GitHub integrations without the colors enabled.
  
This is heavily inspired by the workflows I use in my projects: [My template](https://github.com/EdJoPaTo/rust-binary-metafile-template), [Example](https://github.com/EdJoPaTo/website-stalker).
`cargo fmt`, `cargo clippy` and `cargo test` are also included in my workflows but they seem to be included in the `ci.yml` one which is a bit obscure to me currently.

title: Add version name to GitHub release
Add bash/elvish completions for z
body:
Relevant: https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide/issues/9 https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide/pull/212

- Completions only work when there is one word (therefore completions are always valid).
- By default, it uses the same completions as `cd`.
- If the query ends with `**`, it opens up `fzf` and does an interactive search (similar to [fzf's builtin completions](https://github.com/junegunn/fzf/blob/master/shell/completion.bash)).

title: Support Nushell 0.32.0
body: Incorporates the breaking changes in Nushell 0.32.0 syntax (https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide/issues/208).

title: Remove deleted entries if not accessed in the last 90 days
Improve Fish's completions
body:
This PR brings two improvements to Fish's completions, when completing `{{cmd}}`:
- Let Fish only complete directories and excludes files
- If there is no match in the current directory, Fish will query zoxide with current token and serve them as completions:

  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44045911/118400631-04180f00-b695-11eb-9095-3b6758a447f6.png)

  This is approximately the same as using `zoxide query -i <current token>`, but more integrated with Fish.

Let me know if you have any suggestion over these two changes.

title: Support Fish's private mode
body:
See fish docs: https://fishshell.com/docs/current/#private-mode

In this mode, fish will not record any command history. Some other projects also respect this config, for example [Fish port of z](https://github.com/jethrokuan/z/pull/98). I think it's a nice addition to zoxide!

title: PowerShell should only call hook within filesystem
Prevent endless recusion with alias cd on fish
body:
This is a fix for the endless recursion on fish: fixes #145

- Create a custom __fish_cd function for use in __zoxide_cd.
- The __fish_cd function is set to be either a copy of the fish cd
  wrapper function, or an alias for `builtin cd` as fallback if the
  wrapper function does not exist for some reason.
- This prevents an endless recusion when using `alias cd=z` that would
  occur because __zoxide_cd would call the `cd` alias which would in
  turn call `z` and so on.

title: Fix return values in Bash hook

Update README.md
body: use main branch instead of master for future changes on `install.sh`.

title: Reference integration with nnn (autojump plugin)
body: Added nnn (autojump plugin) to list of third party integrations

title: Remove barely-used aliases
body:
A lot of the aliases defined by zoxide are used very rarely:

- `za`
- `zq`
- `zqi`
- `zr`
- `zri`

Moreover, they contain no special logic and are very easy to redefine:

- `alias za="zoxide add"`
- `alias zq="zoxide query"`
- `alias zqi="zoxide query -i"`
- `alias zr="zoxide remove"`
- `alias zri="zoxide remove -i"`

For that reason, such aliases are better off being left to the user to define as desired. This PR removes these aliases from zoxide.

title: Use variable to prevent hook redefinition
body:
Fixes https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide/issues/147.

Earlier, we were using failure-prone magic to test if the hook had already been defined. In this PR, I've added a new `__zoxide_hooked` variable that checks if the hook has already been defined, and skips it if it is.

title: Use /dev/null on Unix shells
body:
Fixes #150.

Earlier, shells would use `/dev/null` on Linux and `NUL` on Windows. This is unnecessary, because these shells don't support Windows. They are only run on Windows using a POSIX emulation layer like `MSYS2`, which would also use `/dev/null`.

title: Use zero copy deserialization
body: Uses zero copy deserialization for filepaths. After this change, `zoxide query foo` was 43% faster and `zoxide add foo` was 28% faster on my machine.

title: Add Alpine Linux installation instructions
body: Note: Alpine 3.13 has not been released yet, it should be till the end of this year.

title: Forcibly disable backtraces
body: Fixes https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide/issues/129. If there is need for backtraces at some point, we can create a separate environment variable for them.

title: Start fish in an isolated env
body: `fish` in CI complains because the default `$HOME` directory denies any program write access. This PR would create a tempdir for fish to run in.
